summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey and defense attorneys Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson regarding upcoming court appearances for Ghislaine Maxwell, including an arraignment and a bail appeal oral argument.

persons.name: Brad Edwards

persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of email correspondence regarding court scheduling.

persons.name: Maurene Comey

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell', subject of the scheduling discussions.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge who scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: In-person arraignment scheduled by Judge Nathan at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: Remote oral argument scheduled by the Second Circuit at 10 a.m. regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, courtroom 24B (Southern District of New York courthouse)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell had an in-person arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2021, at 2:30 p.m.
A remote oral argument for Maxwell's bail appeal was scheduled with the Second Circuit for April 26, 2021, at 10 a.m.
Prosecutor Maurene Comey corresponded with defense attorneys Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson regarding these court appearances.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in April 2021.
The Second Circuit arguments were noted as being livestreamed to the public.
